intro: Sloanea eugenifloresiae, commonly known as the Ecuadorian sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. Sloanea eugenifloresiae is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
